summary:
The Security Council,

Recalling resolutions 1617 (2005) and 1267 (1999), requests increased cooperation between Interpol and the 1267 Committee, and notes potential benefits for other sanctions committees.

 Requests the Secretary-General to enhance cooperation between the UN and Interpol to provide committees with better tools to fulfil their mandates and help Member States implement Security Council measures.

Encourages Member States to utilize Interpol's tools, such as the I-24/7 global police communications system, to enforce measures like asset freezes, travel bans, and arms embargoes.

Decides to remain seized of the matter.
